result.execSummary:
The defendant Dee Jaye M Makovec was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--to undergo any assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent

--provide DNA sample 

Arresting Agency: Watertown PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dee Jaye M Makovec

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 8:52am [mo]
Defendant Dee Jaye M Makovec in court with Attorney Samantha Jeanne Humes.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:

--to undergo any assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--anger management counseling, if deemed appropriate per the agent
--no acts or threats of violence
--to pay statutory costs 
--provide DNA sample 

Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess: 9:07am

Case called at 9:05 am 
Attorney Samantha Jeanne Humes in court. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Dee Jaye M Makovec not in court.
Atty Humes: Surprised at Miss Makovec's non-appearance, Miss Makovec has been very responsive in this matter. Request the Court pass the case for a moment and recall at later time, so can attempt to reach her.
Court grants - Recess: 9:06 am Reconvene: 9:50 am 

Defendant Dee Jaye M Makovec in court with Attorney Samantha Jeanne Humes. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Humes: Met with ADA Teuber on 1/6/16 but the discovery were waiting for had not arrived.  Was finally received and are still trying to gather more information - expect to done by 3/11/16. Did speak with ADA Teuber and she did agree with timeline, request matter be set for plea/sentencing last week in March or first week in April.
DA Happ: No objection
Court reminds Miss Makovec that her bond/conditions of release remain in effect while case is pending
Recess: 9:54 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule STC (Anticipated Plea/Sentencing) 4/28/16 at 1:45 pm - Send notices

[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Dee Jaye M Makovec in court with Attorney Samantha Jeanne Humes. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Humes advises that there were a couple items of discovery that haven't been received as of today, requesting an addtional pretrial and a status.
ADA Beck agrees.
Court orders bail stands as fixed.

Recess:10:27 am

Defendant Dee Jaye M Makovec in court with Attorney Samantha J. Humes.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Humes requests an additional PTC and STC

Case called at 11:12 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Dee Jaye M Makovec in court. ADA John E K Fryatt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; DOB & address confirmed accurate; reading waived.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Court continues a $500 cash bond, already posted, with conditions: 
-No contact with Leanne Makovec
-No discussion of the facts of the case DGW
-Booking at JCSD
